subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] So is this proof-ative?
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
--_f97f4632-efef-43cb-b4e9-e6ffe5fbe373_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="Windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


 I'm just pissed at the system, so complaining out load. We've only had th=
e dog a couple weeks, she was a rescue dog to begin with. Trouble is, now s=
he thinks I'm her best friend, but I don't think we've exhausted all the op=
tions yet. 
 
 Frank-S


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: tauf03@...=
ate: Thu, 11 Oct 2007 13:49:44 -0700Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] So is this proof=
-ative?




How much will it cost to fix your little dog?  Certainly we all=
 can kick in a few bucks to help you; you've been more than generous with y=
our sharing of your research  and  boxes.  Give us a figure and maybe some =
of us will help  Princess.Joanne :^) Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@hotmail.c=
om> wrote: 


 It's not a question of whether or not the break can be set, =
the question is "How much money do you have?" At this moment--I hate this p=
lace, and humanity sucks!  Frank


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: bulletb=
abea@...: Wed, 10 Oct 2007 17:46:56 -0700Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] S=
o is this proof-ative?



A trip to the vet will answer that question, usua=
lly most breaks can be set unless there is another underlying problem. It i=
s a cute lil dog, sometimes they are very fragile bone structures because o=
f breeding. There are a few small dogs that seem to have alot of problems w=
ith bad backs and breaking legs/feet. 
 
I think its proof to those who wan=
t it, and as for me...nobody is talking about me on the radio, or using my =
full name...so it definitely gets my attention when my name is being used i=
n context with things that are going on around me or happening to people I =
know.
 
I dont need any proof, they just give it freely so I can share or i=
n some cases not share with everyone.
 
I stopped lookin for proof right ab=
out the time this all started. My first evp was all that I needed to get me=
 on this path. My mothers voice, so long after shes been passed, friends, r=
elatives, or even perfect strangers who I had no clue about until I found o=
ut after the fact....way too many proofs have been freely given to me, and =
I never asked for one. Earl and Bob Cox, I think thats one of my favorite W=
OW moments, not knowing about Erland Babcock it was an easy misunderstandin=
g. Luckily I make everything phonetic so it was easy to catch later. I have=
 listened to others evp from him since then and I often STILL hear earl and=
 bob cox. They have also given me names of workers on this side who I have =
bumped into later tho I usually put off contacting anyone they mention unti=
l I think the time is right. Usually it is just weird to find out its a REA=
L LIVE person and that they just happen to be in the EVP/ITC field. 
 
I us=
ed to always assume when they say a name they are talking about spirits the=
re. Or that if I get an ITC image its a spirit face. They proved thats a wr=
ong assumption on several occasions. Probably the only time I ever asked fo=
r anything was while doing an itc session, after so many faces I just wante=
d them to show me something else, anything else, "show me something differe=
nt" led to a few portraits of the living.
 
Sometimes they speak the truth,=
 sometimes a wayward thought creeps threw that shouldnt (or just a creep)..=
. as for the dog...take it to the vet and see what they can do then you wil=
l know more.
 
MistyFrank Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote:


 Whe=
n you get a voice that talks about a specific situation, does that prove so=
mething is talking that is not a broadcast fragment? We do have a dog with =
a broken leg, so it would seem outrageous to suggest the comment received a=
bout a dog and a break would be just a stray broadcast. I hate to have an a=
nimal suffer, but what a piece of evidence! This is what I mean  by judging=
 content and context.   I don't ask questions, I did not ask about the dog.=
 I was only testing the #24 box, and announced, as usuall, that I was doing=
 an EVP recording to test the box.   Frank-S
